title: 5 Key Elements of Locus AG's CarbonNOW Program - No-Till Farmer
summary: Locus AG's CarbonNOW program offers carbon payments to farmers who sequester carbon. The program is particularly attractive to no-tillers who may not qualify for other programs due to their existing practices. The program involves using Locus AG's soil probiotics, which qualify as a practice change for carbon credit programs, and offers guaranteed payments, performance bonuses based on soil testing, and a user-friendly data portal.

title: HYCO1 and Kansas Ethanol Collaborate on World's Largest Biogenic CO2 Utilization Facility - PR Newswire
summary: HYCO1, Inc. and Kansas Ethanol have partnered to build a large-scale biogenic CO2 utilization facility in Kansas. The facility will use HYCO1's CUBE™ technology to convert CO2 emissions into low-carbon intensity syngas and green chemicals, resulting in the production of sustainable products like synthetic base oils and low-carbon jet fuel. This project aims to create a more circular carbon economy by utilizing CO2 emissions and producing valuable products with a reduced carbon footprint.

title: Exterior and Interior Surfaces Can Help Mitigate Air Pollution - ARCHITECT Magazine
summary: The article discusses how buildings can be designed to mitigate the effects of wildfire smoke and other forms of air pollution. It highlights innovations in materials and technologies, such as photocatalytic coatings on facades and roofing granules that reduce nitrogen oxide levels. Additionally, the article explores the potential of bio-based installations that utilize living organisms to improve air quality.

title: REPLENISH NUTRIENTS ANNOUNCES $7 MILLION IN NON-DILUTIVE FUNDING - Canada NewsWire
summary: Replenish Nutrients, a subsidiary of EarthRenew Inc., has secured a $7 million grant from Emissions Reductions Alberta (ERA) to construct a regenerative fertilizer manufacturing facility near Debolt, Alberta. This facility will produce up to 50,000 metric tons of regenerative fertilizer per year, replacing traditional synthetic fertilizers with a low-salt alternative made from recycled organic matter, aiming to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and enhance soil health.
